term.title: silylene

item.text: Generic name for H2Si: and substitution derivatives thereof, containing an electrically neutral bivalent silicon atom with two non-bonding electrons. (The definition is analogous to that given for carbene.)
The silanediyl group (H2Si), analogous to the methylene group (H2C).

term.sources: 'Glossary of terms used in physical organic chemistry (IUPAC Recommendations 1994)' Muller, P.; Pure and Applied Chemistry 1994 66(5) 1077
term.citation: Citation: 'silylene' in IUPAC Compendium of Chemical Terminology, 5th ed. International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry; 2025. Online version 5.0.0, 2025. 10.1351/goldbook.S05673

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
